intro: Eupatorium antiquorum, commonly known as the ancient eupatorium, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers, which appear in late summer, are small and clustered in umbels, producing a pale blue to purple color. Eupatorium antiquorum is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands.
